![Daegwallyeong Sky Ranch (대관령 하늘목장)](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037172_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Daegwallyeong Sky Ranch, established in 1974, is located on a 100 million ㎡ plot of land in the highlands of Daegwallyeong Pass. The ranch opened to the public as a tourist attraction in 2014. The environmentally friendly ranch raises over 400 cows, 100 sheep and 40 horses. Visitors can easily view the ranch by riding a tractor over the 5-kilometer-long course. The view of the ranch and surrounding area is best seen from the sky deck observatory, located at 1,000 meters above sea level. The ranch also features four themed walking paths. Available activities include horseback riding, and feeding baby animals. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |accomcount:|N/A| |expagerange:|Open to visitors of all ages
* Horseback riding open to visitors ages 6 and older| |infocenter:|• 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
• For more info: +82-33-322-8061| |opendate:|2014| |parking:|Available (Sedans 100 spaces / Large vehicles 20 spaces)| |restdate:|N/A (Open all year round)| |usetime:|October-March 09:00-17:30
April-September 09:00-18:00| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Film Locations:|Drama "Lovestruck in the City (2020)"
Variety program "Running Man," "2 Days & 1 Night," "I Live Alone"| |Admission Fees:|Adults 7,000 won / Children 5,000 won| |Available Facilities:|Sheep ranch, horse ranch, cafe, store, rest area| |Facility Utilization Fees:|Tractor ride - Adults 7,000 won / Children 6,000 won
Horseback riding - 10,000 won
Feeding experience - 2,000 won| |Restrooms:|Available| |Parking Fees:|Free| |Interpretation Services Offered:|Not available| ## Detail Image ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1946993_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1946993_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1946994_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1946994_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1946995_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1946995_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1946998_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1946998_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1947001_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/1947001_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037173_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037173_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037174_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037174_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037175_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037175_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037176_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658781380182/2037176_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [☎️+82-33-322-8061](tel:+82333228061) - [🏠skyranch.co.kr](http://skyranch.co.kr/) ```googleMap latitude: 37.7071731576 longitude: 128.7188396792 title: 458-23, Kkotbadyangji-gil, Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon-do ``` ## Directions [Taxi]
Approx. 30 min from Jinbu (Odaesan) Station

data.title: Daegwallyeong Sky Ranch (대관령 하늘목장)
data.description: Daegwallyeong Sky Ranch, established in 1974, is located on a 100 million ㎡ plot of land in the highlands of Daegwallyeong Pass. The ranch opened to the public as a tourist attraction in 2014. The environmentally friendly ranch raises over 400 cows, 100 sheep and 40 horses. Visitors can easily view the ranch by riding a tractor over the 5-kilometer-long course. The view of the ranch and surrounding area is best seen from the sky deck observatory, located at 1,000 meters above sea level. The ranch also features four themed walking paths. Available activities include horseback riding, and feeding baby animals.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Haslla Art World (하슬라아트월드)
dataList.description: Haslla Art World is an art space that harmonizes nature, people and art. The Sculpture Garden, approximately 27 acres in size, offers various themed gardens and structures. Contemporary Gallery has approximately 200 contemporary artworks, while Pinocchio & Marionette Gallery has various artworks from all over Europe. Haslla Art World has exhibitions and performances throughout the year, providing visitors with a special experience every time they visit.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Hanwha Resort Seorak Waterpia (한화리조트 설악 워터피아)
dataList.description: Located within Seorak Hanwha Resort, nestled at the foot of Seoraksan Mountain and before the deep blue ocean, Seorak Waterpia is a hot springs water theme park that uses 100% pure natural hot springs water.  The park is divided into a spa zone and water zone, with major facilities including an indoor sauna, water play facilities, and a rooftop leisure spa. In particular, the outdoor sauna is quite popular for its view of Seoraksan Mountain. The water throughout the park is kept at a toasty 49 degrees Celsius, making for a fun spa experience year round and fun for the whole family.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Hantangang River [National Geopark] (한탄강(국가지질공원, 고석정))
dataList.description: Goseok Rock, located in the area of Hantangang River, is a granite rock that reach 15 meters in x_height. The area is often called Goseokjeong, named after the nearby Goseokjeong Pavilion. The area is an important geology and topography learning site where it is visible to see the topography before the formation of the basalt lava field and the fact that the basalt lava flowed over the bedrock to form the lava field. Goseok is a bedrock that existed before the area of Cheorwon was covered with lava, and is a granite formed underground about 110 million years ago (mid Cretaceous period). It is covered in basalt lava by volcanic activity that occurred between about 540,000 and 120,000 years ago, and then eroded by the Hantangang River to form a new waterway.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Hani Lavender Farm (하늬라벤더팜)
dataList.description: Hani Lavender Farm was opened on a 33,000 ㎡ plot of land in 2006 by Ha Deok-ho, the lavender missionary. Mr. Ha originally operated an herb shop in Gyeonggi-do but moved to Goseong to grow his own lavender farm. The area of the farm has the ideal condition for lavender to grow.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Hambaeksan Mountain (함백산)
dataList.description:
With an elevation of 1,573 meters above sea level, Hambaeksan Mountain is the tallest mountain in the eastern part of Gangwon-do. The main ridge of the mountain stretches between the city of Taebaek to the east and Yeongwol and Jeongseon counties to the west. The mountain offers a fine vantage point from which to get a sweeping look at the entire region (including Taebaeksan and Baegunsan mountains) and commands a striking view of the sunrise over East Sea. The three starting points for hiking Hambaeksan Mountain are Dumundongjae Pass, Manhangjae Pass, and the entrance to the Jeokjoam Hermitage. The hiking path that begins at Dumundongjae Pass and leads to the peak is especially recommended for its scenic views. Hambaeksan Mountain is particularly well known for its breathtaking snowscapes and extensive wildflower beds.

Hambaeksan Mountain is also home to Jeongamsa Temple, which was built by Buddhist monk Jajangyulsa in the year 636 during the reign of Queen Seondeok of the Silla Kingdom. The temple is home to the Sumanotap Pagoda (Treasure No. 410) and is bordered by a stream that provides a natural habitat for the Brachmystax lenok (Natural Monument No. 73), a member of the trout family.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Hajodae Unmanned Lighthouse (하조대 무인등대)
dataList.description:
The Hajodae Unmanned Lighthouse sits along a cliff with an old pine tree and overlooks the East Sea. Legend has it the name Hajodae came from the first sounds of Haryun and Jojun, two of the founding members of the Joseon dynasty who stayed nearby during one of their journeys.

The area is famous as a filming spot for the drama Taejo Wang Geon (2000). A walk along the cliff will lead to a white lighthouse near the bridge beside Hajodae Cliff. A number of tourists also visit Hajodae for the beautiful sunrises and the beam of light from the lighthouse that appears when darkness falls.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Hajodae Beach (하조대해수욕장)
dataList.description: Hajodae Beach is located in Yangyang-gun famous for the beautiful scenery of the deep blue ocean, soft sandy shore, a nearby lighthouse, and unique rock formations and stony islets. The beach is roughly 1.5 kilometers, at an average x_width of 100 meters, and a coastal incline of 1.5 meters. Gwangjeongcheon and Sanguncheon Streams run into the ocean near the beach, creating slightly warmer waters than other areas along the eastern coast. During the summer season, visitors can pay to pitch a tent on the beach or in the pine forest campground. The beach is complete with a parking lot, shower booth, drinking fountain, and restroom among other amenities. The beach is open for swimming between July and August, and is the venue for many festivals and events throughout the year. Hajodae Pavilion, one of the Eight Scenic Sights of Yangyang, and a skywalk observatory are located nearby.
dataList.author: korea-tour
